metadata.title: CVE-2023-52768 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: wifi:wilc1000: use vmm_table as array in wilc struct Enabling KASAN and runningsome iperf tests raises some memory issues with vmm_table: BUG: KASAN:slab-out-of-bounds in wilc_wlan_handle_txq+0x6ac/0xdb4 Write of size 4 ataddr c3a61540 by task wlan0-tx/95 KASAN detects that we are writing databeyond range allocated to vmm_table. There is indeed a mismatch between thesize passed to allocator in wilc_wlan_init, and the range of possibleindexes used later: allocation size is missing a multiplication bysizeof(u32)

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52768` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
